content.question:
<math alttext="C 6 H 12 O 6 solid plus 6 O 2 gas react to produce 6 C O 2 gas plus 6 H 2 O gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>6</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="delta S naught of reaction equals positive 900 decimal point joules per mole of reaction, kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>900.</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>J/(mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>K)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

Substance
 Approximate <math alttext="S naught joules per mole kelvin" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>S</mi> <mi>°</mi> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mtext>(J/(mol</mtext> <mo>⋅</mo> <mtext>K))</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

<math alttext="C 6 H 12 O 6 solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
 209

<math alttext="O 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
 205

<math alttext="H 2 O gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="question mark" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>?</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="C O 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
 214

The chemical equation above represents the combustion of glucose, and the table provides the approximate standard absolute entropies, <math alttext="S naught" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, for some substances. Based on the information given, which of these equations can be used to calculate an approximate value of <math alttext="S naught" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="H 2 O gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="S naught equals 900 plus 209 plus 205 minus 214, joules per mole, kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mrow><mn>900</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>209</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>205</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>214</mn></mrow><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>J/(mol</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>K)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="S naught equals one sixth, open bracket, 900 plus 209, plus, open parenthesis, 6 times 205, close parenthesis, minus, open parenthesis, 6 times 214, close parenthesis, close bracket, joules per mole, kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mrow><mn>900</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>209</mn><mo>+</mo><mtext>(</mtext><mn>6</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>205</mn><mtext>)</mtext><mo>−</mo><mtext>(</mtext><mn>6</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>214</mn><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>J/(mol</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>K)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="S naught equals one sixth, open bracket, negative 900 minus, open parenthesis, 6 times 214, close parenthesis, plus 209, plus, open parenthesis, 6 times 205, close parenthesis, close bracket, joules per mole, kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>900</mn><mo>−</mo><mtext>(</mtext><mn>6</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>214</mn><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>209</mn><mo>+</mo><mtext>(</mtext><mn>6</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>205</mn><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>J/(mol</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>K)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="S naught equals negative 900 minus 214, plus 209, plus 205 joules per mole, kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>900</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>214</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>209</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>205</mn></mrow><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>J/(mol</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>K)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="S naught equals one sixth, open bracket, 900 plus 209, plus, open parenthesis, 6 times 205, close parenthesis, minus, open parenthesis, 6 times 214, close parenthesis, close bracket, joules per mole, kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mrow><mn>900</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>209</mn><mo>+</mo><mtext>(</mtext><mn>6</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>205</mn><mtext>)</mtext><mo>−</mo><mtext>(</mtext><mn>6</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>214</mn><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>J/(mol</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>K)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
